workbook.name: Optimal Charging Station
workbook.description:
You are in an electric car that is almost out of charge. 

In this demo, we use Kinetica’s graph API to create a 1.2 million node graph representation of the road network in and around Detroit. We then use this graph network to find the optimal route between a source and destination point by picking the best charging station out of 268 different options. We repeat these computations every 5 seconds using a SQL procedure with new sets of source and destination points that are streaming in from a Kafka topic.

worksheets.name: Create and explore the graph network

7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"RUN THE SHORTEST PATH SOLVERS","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Now that we have the graph representation of the road network we can run solvers against it. We want to do this so that the calculation is performed periodically for new data."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"1. Our first task is to find all charging stations within 2400 seconds of our starting point."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"2. Next we need to find the shortest path from the current destination to all the EV charging stations (inverse shortest path)"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"3. Finally, we combine all the paths from the first two solves to find the one that has the minimum weight (i.e time for travel). This will be the shortest path from the source to destination with a stop at a charging station."}]}]

7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"MAP SHOWING THE COMBINED PATH","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The path below shows the shortest path between the source and the destination point with a stop at a charging station that is within 40 minutes of the source point."}]}]

7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE PROCEDURE shortest_path_updater
BEGIN
    -- STEP 1: Run the shortest path solver from the source to all EV charging stations within a 2400 sec radius
    CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE source_to_charging_path AS
    SELECT * 
    FROM TABLE (
        SOLVE_GRAPH
        (
            GRAPH => 'mm_lakes',
            SOLVER_TYPE => 'SHORTEST_PATH',
            SOURCE_NODES => INPUT_TABLE(
                SELECT ST_GEOMFROMTEXT(source_pt) AS WKTPOINT 
                FROM source_dest 
                ORDER BY TIMESTAMP DESC -- Find the latest source record
                LIMIT 1
            ),
            DESTINATION_NODES => INPUT_TABLE(
                SELECT 
                    Longitude AS X,
                    Latitude AS Y 
                FROM mm_evcharging
            ),
            OPTIONS => KV_PAIRS(max_solution_radius = '2400')
        )
    );
    -- Step 2: Run the inverse shortest path solver from all EV charging stations to the destination
    CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE charging_to_dest_path AS
    SELECT * 
    FROM TABLE (
        SOLVE_GRAPH
        (
            GRAPH => 'mm_lakes',
            SOLVER_TYPE => 'INVERSE_SHORTEST_PATH',
            SOURCE_NODES => INPUT_TABLE(
                SELECT ST_GEOMFROMTEXT(dest_pt) AS WKTPOINT 
                FROM source_dest 
                ORDER BY TIMESTAMP DESC -- Find the latest destination record
                LIMIT 1
            ),
            DESTINATION_NODES => INPUT_TABLE(
                SELECT 
                    Longitude AS X,
                    Latitude AS Y 
                FROM mm_evcharging
            )
        )
    );
    -- Step 3: Find the combined path that minimizes the cost from source to destination with a stop at an EV charging station
    
    INSERT INTO optimal_route /* ki_hint_update_on_existing_pk */  
    SELECT * 
    FROM
    (
        WITH temp (id_with_min_cost) AS
        (
            SELECT arg_min(s1+s2,id1) as id_with_min_cost FROM
                (SELECT  SOLVERS_NODE_COSTS as s1, SOLVERS_NODE_ID as id1, * from source_to_charging_path),
                (SELECT  SOLVERS_NODE_COSTS as s2, SOLVERS_NODE_ID as id2, * from charging_to_dest_path)
            WHERE id1 = id2
        )
        SELECT 
            1 as pk_id,     --this is the primary key so we will always be overwriting this record
            s1.wktroute as wkt1,
            s2.wktroute as wkt2,
            st_linemerge(st_collect(s1.wktroute,s2.wktroute)) as wkt_full
        FROM 
            source_to_charging_path s1, 
            charging_to_dest_path s2,
            temp 
        WHERE 
            s1.SOLVERS_NODE_ID = temp.id_with_min_cost and
            s2.SOLVERS_NODE_ID = temp.id_with_min_cost
    );
END 
EXECUTE FOR EVERY 10 SECONDS 
"

7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"MAP SHOWING THE SHORTEST PATH FROM  ALL EV STATIONS TO THE LATEST DESTINATION","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"This map updates every 2 seconds."}]}]

7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"SELF REFRESHING MAP SHOWING THE SHORTEST PATH FROM SOURCE TO ALL EV STATIONS (WITHIN 2400 SECS)","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The map below is set to refresh every 2 secs to show updated paths based on latest source destination."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"✎ NOTE","bold":true},{"text":": The table that is referenced might be missing occassionally (API error) because the map refresh might coincide with the execution of the stored procedure. Occasionally, there might not be a path shown on the map below (even when there is no error). This is because the current source point doesn't have an EV charging station that is within 40 minutes from it. Additionally, the data will "}]}]

7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content:
"-- Create the optimal route table to store the most current result from the SQL procedure below
CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE optimal_route
(
    pk_id INT (PRIMARY_KEY) NOT NULL,
    wkt1 GEOMETRY NOT NULL,
    wkt2 GEOMETRY NOT NULL,
    wkt_full GEOMETRY
)
"

7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7f635b40-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"EXPLAINING THE SQL PROCEDURE AND SOLVERS","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The SQL procedure below does all of the analytical work for this example. A SQL procedure is an executable batch of SQL statements that can be run either on schedule or on demand by the user. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The procedure below performs three steps."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"1. Calculate the shortest path from the current source to all EV charging stations that are within 40 minutes (sometime this will yield no results because there aren't any charging stations within that radius from the current source point)."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"2. Calculate the inverse shortest path from all EV charging stations to the current destination."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"3. Find the path from the source to a destination with an EV charging station stop that has the lowest combined weight."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The SQL procedure is run on a schedule of every 5 seconds. This means that every 5 seconds we find the most current source and destination point (from the Kafka topic ingest) and recompute the steps above based on these."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The maps below the procedure show the two shortest path routes (Source to EV and EV to destination) and the combined route with minimum cost. They are set to refresh every few seconds so that we see the most updated version of the output."}]}]

7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content:
"-- Drop the table if it already exists
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS mm_lakes_shape;

LOAD DATA INTO mm_lakes_shape
FROM FILE PATHS 'mm_lakes_shape.csv'
FORMAT TEXT
WITH OPTIONS (
    DATA SOURCE = 'ev_data_source'
)"

7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE DATA SOURCE ev_data_source
LOCATION = 'S3' 
WITH OPTIONS (
    ANONYMOUS = 'true',
    BUCKET NAME = 'guidesdatapublic',
    REGION = 'us-east-1'
)"

7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"REGISTER THE STATIC DATA SOURCE","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The static data for this example is stored in a Amazon S3 bucket. Let's register that so that we can connect to it. The files in this data source are publicly accessible, so we don't have to use any credentials to access them."}]}]

7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"LOAD THE DATA FROM THE S3 DATA SOURCE INTO TABLES IN KINETICA","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"We will be loading data from two files that are on AWS S3."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"1. The first table contains the road network data for the greater Michigan area. This is a large file that contains WKT linestrings for different road segments along with information on average speeds, time for traversal, direction etc."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"2. The second table contains EV charging station locations in the greater Michigan area"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"✎ NOTE","bold":true},{"text":": We are directly loading the files into tables without defining them in advance. Kinetica has an excellent type inferencing system that does a good job of inferring data types on the fly. In addition, the data that we are using for this example has a Kinetica compatible CSV header format that is used to define the table data."}]}]

7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content:
"-- Drop the table if it already exists
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS mm_evcharging;

LOAD DATA INTO mm_evcharging
FROM FILE PATHS 'mm_evcharging.csv'
FORMAT TEXT
WITH OPTIONS (
    DATA SOURCE = 'ev_data_source'
)"

7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content:
"-- Drop the table into which we will be streaming (if it exists) so that we can recreate the credential
DROP TABLE IF EXISTS source_dest;

CREATE OR REPLACE CREDENTIAL ev_creds
TYPE = 'kafka',
IDENTITY = '' ,
SECRET = ''
WITH OPTIONS (  
   'security.protocol' = 'SASL_SSL',
   'sasl.mechanism' = 'PLAIN',
   'sasl.username' = 'FKHU5OKQSM6J3FZY',
   'sasl.password' = 'BT0b0049Q016ncuMUD0Pt5bRPr6YZu9YNioEtGqfuaN1pPmwyPUVMytUWloqtt8o'
   )"

7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE DATA SOURCE streaming_source_dest
LOCATION = 'kafka://pkc-ep9mm.us-east-2.aws.confluent.cloud:9092'
WITH OPTIONS 
(
    kafka_topic_name =  'ev_source_dest',
    credential = 'ev_creds'
)"

7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content:
"-- Create the table for streaming ingest
CREATE OR REPLACE TABLE source_dest
(
    source_pt GEOMETRY NOT NULL,
    dest_pt GEOMETRY NOT NULL,
    TIMESTAMP timestamp NOT NULL
);

LOAD DATA INTO source_dest
FORMAT JSON 
WITH OPTIONS (
    DATA SOURCE = 'streaming_source_dest',
    SUBSCRIBE = TRUE,
    TYPE_INFERENCE_MODE = 'speed',
    ERROR_HANDLING = 'permissive',
    POLL_INTERVAL = '5 seconds'
)"

7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"REGISTER THE STREAMING DATA SOURCE","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The source and destination points are streaming in from a Kafka topic on Confluent. We can first define the credentials for confluent as shown below. Once registered, we can use the credential to connect to the data source on Confluent."}]}]

7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
7fc0e490-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"LOAD THE DATA STREAM FROM KAFKA","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"This time we define the table befor proceeding with the ingest."}]}]

803cf260-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
803cf260-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"THE SOLUTION","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"We will use Kinetica's graph API to solve this problem. Kinetica provides a generic and extensible design of networks with the aim of being tailored or used for various real-life applications, such as transportation, utility, social, and geospatial. Here are the analytical steps."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"1. Create the graph: Each road segment (edge) has an associated direction of travel (one-way, two-way), the time taken to travel (weight). We use this information to model the road network as a weighted directed graph."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"2. Find the shortest path from the source to all electric vehicle (EV) charging stations that are within range (40 mins)."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"3. Find the inverse shortest path from all EV charging stations to the destination point."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"4. Find the path from the source to destination via a charging station that has minimum cost."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"bold":true,"text":"USING KINETICA TO SOLVE HARDER PROBLEMS"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"We extend this use case further by adding a streaming component. Instead of running the shortest path solvers once, we use a streaming ingest from Kafka that sends out new source and destination points to run this calculation against new inputs every 5 seconds. Since Kinetica is a fully vectorized database, it can perform computationally challenging tasks even on lower end machines."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":""}]}]

803cf260-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
803cf260-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"THE DATA","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"1. The road network data for Detroit. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"2. Location of EV charging stations"}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"3. A data stream of source and destination points"}]}]

803cf260-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
803cf260-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"FIND THE BEST ROUTE WITH A CHARGING PIT STOP","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"This workbook models the following scenario. You would like to go from a random source point to a random destination point in the Detroit region using an electric car."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"However, you have a problem. Your car only has enough charge to travel an hour. To be on the safer side, you would like to find a charging station that is within 40 minutes from when you start before you get to your destination (irrespective of whether the destination is less than an hour away). Once charged, you would like to then proceed to your final destination."}]}]

806d0310-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block 1
806d0310-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content:
"CREATE OR REPLACE DIRECTED GRAPH mm_lakes 
(
    EDGES => INPUT_TABLE(
        SELECT  
            shape AS WKTLINE, 
            direction AS DIRECTION,
            time AS WEIGHT_VALUESPECIFIED
        FROM mm_lakes_shape
    ),
    OPTIONS => KV_PAIRS(
        graph_table = 'mm_lakes_graph_table'
    )
);"

806d0310-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
806d0310-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"CREATE THE GRAPH","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Now that we have all the data we need for this example in tables in Kinetica we can start with the analytical tasks. "}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"Our first task is to convert the road network into a graph representation. Each road segment in the data becomes an edge on the graph, the direction of traffic becomes the edge direction and the time for traveling a segment, the edge weight."}]}]

806d0310-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
806d0310-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"A DESCRIPTION OF THE GRAPH NETWORK DATA USING THE OPTIONAL OUTPUT TABLE","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"When creating the graph we used on an optional parameter to create an output table as well. While this optional tabular representation is not used for any of the analytical tasks using graphs like querying, solving and matching, we can use it to visualize the graph network and to inspect the data."}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The table is shown below. Each row in the table represents an edge on the graph and has information on the WKTLINE, the weight (time for traversing the edge) and the direction of travel."}]}]

806d0310-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
806d0310-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"VISUALIZE THE GRAPH","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"We can use the optional graph output table to visualize the graph on a map. Click on the refresh icon (top left) to display the map. Click on one of the road segments to see the associate row of data from the output table."}]}]

806d0310-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
806d0310-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"LOCATION OF EV CHARGING STATIONS","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"We will use the spatial graph network depicted above in combination with the location of the EV charging stations show below to find the optimal path from source and destination points."}]}]

80a77400-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.name: Block
80a77400-44e9-11ed-8743-9909f6ef0c85.content: [{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"PAUSE SUBSCRIPTIONS","bold":true}]},{"type":"paragraph","children":[{"text":"The Kafka topic that we are subscribed to is always on. So data will continue to load into the connected Kinetica table unless we pause the subscription. You can follow the instructions here (https://docs.kinetica.com/7.1/sql/ddl/#manage-subscription) to resume your subscription anytime you would like to."}]}]
